Keywords: Avengers , Codex , Defenders , Midnight Sons , Monster , Mystical
Real Name: Stephen Strange
Special Powers
TARGETING: This character can make range attacks while adjacent to opposing characters. (May target adjacent or non-adjacent opposing characters.)
SUMMON HELP FROM THE VENOMVERSE: When Venom Dr. Strange hits an opposing character, if no character has been placed this turn, after resolutions you may roll a d6. 3-6: Choose a character on your sideline whose name includes "Venom" of equal or less points to place adjacent. This game that character can't be carried, replace, or be replaced, and returns to your sideline at the beginning of your next turn.
SYMBIOTE: Plasticity, Shape Change.
IT WAS MY DECISION TO BRING YOU ALL TOGETHER: Leadership, Probability Control.

December 14, 2022
Exothermic
[URL="https://wizkids.com/heroclix/2021/02/17/heroclix-2021-rules-article-7-whats-in-a-name/"]https://wizkids.com/heroclix/2021/02/17/heroclix-2021-rules-article-7-whats-in-a-name/[/URL] "Place vs Places The word 'place' has meant two totally different things in HeroClix. Worse, when effects want to make sure no friendly characters have been placed this turn, it only refers to one of those two. This is needlessly confusing. When a character would be repositioned, we’re still going to use the word placed. It will still mean that a character has been transported on the map without taking a move action. When a character would be added to the map, we’ll use the keyphrase 'generate' moving forward. They might be added to the map because they were generated, or because they were swapped in for another character (like with Shifting Focus)." I'm having difficulty finding it, but I know somewhere WizKids said this change was backwards compatible as well.
